Desc.Basic: 使用物品時調用。如果物品在此類下具有至少一個腳本調用，其無論如何都可用。該調用會具有額外對象 {var1}， 其中含有用于創建物品攻擊的底層數據。
Desc.Extra1: Setting shared.hideChat to true prevents a chat card from being shown.
Desc.Extra2: Setting shared.reject to true prevents the item from being used, take away charges and showing a chat card.

Desc.Basic: Called when a buff or feature has been toggled on/off. This call will have an additional variable {var1} which is either true if it has just been enabled or false if it has just been disabled.

Called when the quantity of a physical item has been changed. This call will have the additional variables {var1} and {var2}, which contains the quantity numbers before and after the update respectively.
Called when the level of a item has been changed. This call will have the additional variables {var1} and {var2}, which contains the numbers before and after the update respectively.
Called when an item has been equipped or unequipped. This call will have an additional variable {var1} which is either true if it has just been equipped, or false if it has just been unequipped.
Most items have certain categories of script calls, which are a combination of macros and inline scripts which run at specific events for that item.
In order to use Macros as Script Calls, simply drag a macro over from somewhere to the category of Script Calls you wish to run them on.
The variable availability differs somewhat from what's available in regular Macros. Below you will find a list of variables which are present within Script Calls.

Item.Desc: The item from which this event was called.

Actor.Desc: The actor which owns the calling item. Can be null if the item is not on an actor.

Token.Desc: The token of the associated actor, if any.

Shared.Desc: An object which starts out as empty, but is shared between all script calls of a single event, after which it is returned to the calling function, which may or may not do something with it.

Desc.Basic: Flags can be used by modules and macros. Boolean Flags don't do anything by themselves, but Dictionary Flags can be used in rolls, in addition to their use in macros and modules.

DictionaryFlags.Basic: You can access Dictionary Flags within rolls by using @dFlags.(itemTag).(flagName), or with @item.dFlags.(flagName) within the current item.

Generic.EnhancementBonusDesc: The item's enhancement bonus, as per the Core rules
Generic.MasterworkDesc: Whether the item is masterwork, as per the Core rules
Generic.BrokenDesc: Whether the item is broken, as per the Core rules
Generic.EquippedDesc: Whether the item is currently equipped, and transfers its changes to its actor (if any)
Generic.IdentifiedDesc: Whether the item is currently identified, and shows its identified information to players
Generic.SizeDesc: The item's size, similar to a character's size

Weapons.Label: Weapons
Weapons.Desc: Weapons are meant to represent physical weapons that a character can hold.
Weapons.CategoryDesc: The weapon's category (simple, martial, exotic or misc)
Weapons.TypeDesc: The weapon's type (light, one-handed, two-handed or ranged)
Weapons.SizeDesc: The weapon's size, similar to a character's size
Weapons.PropertiesDesc: The weapon's properties, as per the Core rules (does nothing mechanically)
Weapons.BonusAttackFormulaDesc: The weapon's attack bonus formula. Some examples:

BonusAttackFormulaExamples.0: Will incur a penalty to the attack roll of -2 if the wielder's Strength modifier is lower than 3

Weapons.BaseWeaponDamageDesc: The first field indicates the damage die a Medium-sized weapon would deal, and the second field indicates the type of damage it deals (i.e. Bludgeoning, Slashing, etc.)
Weapons.BonusDamageFormulaDesc: The bonus damage the weapon deals. Some examples:

BonusDamageFormulaExamples.0: Will add either 4 or the wielder's Strength modifier to the damage roll, whichever is lower

Weapons.BaseWeaponCriticalDesc: The first field indicates the lowest result of the attack's d20 to be a critical threat, and the second field indicates the amount by which the damage is multiplied

Equipment.Label: Equipment
Equipment.Desc: Equipment represents all non-weapon equippable items, including armor, shields, rings and wondrous items.
Equipment.CategoryDesc: The armor's category (whether it's armor, a shield, or something else)
Equipment.TypeDesc: Armor or Shield size type, or other item type (clothing, wondrous item, etc.)
Equipment.SlotDesc: What slot this item is for (only shows up for items other than armor or shields)
Equipment.StatusDesc: Status flags of this particular item

Consumables.Label: Consumables
Consumables.Desc: Consumables represent physical items with limited uses, such as potions or wands.

Containers.Label: Containers
Containers.Desc: Containers are items which can contain other items.

Loot.Label: Loot
Loot.Desc: Loot items are all types of physical items that don't fit in other major categories, such as trade goods and ammunition.

Description.Label: Description
Description.Name: Name
Description.NameDesc: The name of the item, if identified.
Description.UnidentifiedNameDesc: The name of the item, if unidentified. Shows the identified name for players if left empty.
Description.DescriptionDesc: The description to show, if identified.
Description.UnidentifiedDescriptionDesc: The description to show to players, if unidentified.
Description.PriceDesc: The price of the item, in gold pieces, if identified
Description.UnidentifiedPriceDesc: The price of the item, in gold pieces, if unidentified.

LoseDexToAC.Label: Lose Dex to AC
LoseDexToAC.Desc: While an item with this change is active, a character loses his Dexterity bonuses to Armor Class.

SetAbility.Label: X Ability
SetAbility.Desc: Sets the appropriate ability to the flag's specified value. This might be removed in a later version, since the same can be accomplished with the '=' operator (see below).

DwarfLikeEncumbrance.Label: Dwarf-like Encumbrance
DwarfLikeEncumbrance.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by being in a medium or heavy load.

FullSpeedMediumArmor.Label: Full Speed in Medium Armor
FullSpeedMediumArmor.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by wearing medium armor.

FullSpeedHeavyArmor.Label: Full Speed in Heavy Armor
FullSpeedHeavyArmor.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by wearing heavy armor.

Changes.Label: Changes
Changes.Desc: This is a list of changes which affect the actor owning the item directly. From left to right:

Formula.Label: Formula
Formula.Desc: The formula by which to affect this particular change. The way this alters an actor's attribute depends on the operator (see next). See {tagOpen}this page{tagClose} for more details.

Operator.Label: Operator
Operator.Desc: The operators are '+' (relative), '=' (absolute) or 'S' (script). Relative values add to an attribute, while absolute values set the attribute to the result of the formula. See below for the script operator.

Priority.Label: Priority
Priority.Desc: The priority of this change. Changes with lower priorities will be processed later.

Target.Label: Target
Target.Desc: A general category of the attribute to alter.

SubTarget.Label: Sub-Target
SubTarget.Desc: The specific attribute to alter with this change.

ContextNotes.Label: Context Notes
ContextNotes.Desc: This a list of contextual notes, which are shown in appropriate situations. From left to right:

Description.Label: Description
Description.Desc: The description to show in appropriate situations. Every newline adds a new description to the same target. You can use Foundry-style inline rolls in these.

Target.Label: Target
Target.Desc: A general category of the attribute to alter.

SubTarget.Label: Sub-Target
SubTarget.Desc: The specific attribute to alter with this change.

ScriptOperator.Label: Script Operator
ScriptOperator.Desc: The 'formula' of changes using the Script operator are actually small JavaScript scripts that are run when processing changes. Some JavaScript knowledge is required to understand these.

Variables.Desc: Within these scripts, the following variables can be used:

0.Name: d
0.Desc: The roll data at the time of processing the change. Contains any variable you could use within a normal change formula using the `@` symbol.

1.Name: result
1.Desc:
This contains two more variables, value and operator. Set value to the numeric result you want for the change, and operator to either "add" or "set".

value defaults to 0 and operator defaults to "add".

Functions.Label: Functions
Functions.Desc: The following are functions you can use within formulas, and examples on how to use them.

Max.Desc: Returns the highest of the given numbers.

Examples.0: Returns the either the actor's Strength modifier or the actor's Dexterity modifier, whichever is higher.

Min.Desc: Returns the lowest of the given numbers.

Examples.0: Returns the either the actor's Hit Die total or the number 10, whichever is lower.

Floor.Desc: Rounds the given number down to the lowest integer.

Examples.0: Returns half of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded down.

Ceil.Desc: Rounds the given number down to the highest integer.

Examples.0: Returns half of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded up.

Round.Desc: Rounds the given number to the nearest integer.

Examples.0: Returns one third of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded to the nearest whole number.

SquareRoot.Desc: Returns the positive square root of the given number.

Power.Desc: Returns x to the power of y.

SizeRoll.Desc: Alters a damage roll to that of another size category.

Examples.0: Rolls 1d8 for medium actors, and alters the damage formula according to the calling actor's current size.
Examples.1:
Translates a damage roll of 1d4 from a tiny actor (size '2') to a huge actor (size '6')
Output: 3d6

SizeReach.Desc: Generates a number equal to the reach of a creature of a certain size and stature.

Examples.0: Returns the normal melee reach as if the actor was 1 size category higher.
Examples.1: Returns the reach a huge, long actor would have with a reach weapon.

Formulas.Label: Formulas
Formulas.Desc: Formulas are an important aspect in the Pathfinder 1e system. They can be as simple as a single numerical value, or as complex as single lines of code. They play a great role in item changes.
Formulas.Desc2: For a quick reference, you can find a lot of this information in tooltips on actor sheets as well.

Variables.Label: Variables
Variables.Desc: Below you will find an (incomplete) list of variables you can use within your formulas.

AbilityScoreTotal.Desc: The total value of an ability score. Replace X with one of the following: 'str', 'dex', 'con', 'int', 'wis', 'cha'.

AbilityScoreMod.Desc: The modifier of an ability score. Replace X with one of the following: 'str', 'dex', 'con', 'int', 'wis', 'cha'.

HitDie.Desc: The total hit die the actor has. This is a combination of class levels and racial hit die, and it excludes mythic tiers.

SavingThrows.Desc: The total bonus of the appropriate saving throw for that actor. X can be either 'fort' (Fortitude), 'ref' (Reflex) or 'will' (Will)

SavingThrowsBase.Desc: The total base bonus of the appropriate saving throw for that actor, as given by class levels. X can be either 'fort' (Fortitude), 'ref' (Reflex) or 'will' (Will)

EncumbranceLevel.Desc: The current encumbrance level of the actor.

ArmorType.Desc: The type of armor the actor is wearing.

ShieldType.Desc: The type of shield the actor is holding.

CombatRound.Desc: The current round of combat, or 0 if not in combat.

CritMult.Desc: The critical multiplier of the attack, or 1 if the attack is not a critical threat. Only appropriate for use in damage rolls and attack and effect notes.

Hidden.Label: Hidden
Hidden.Description: Hidden compendiums will not show up for players in compendium browsers.

Disabled.Label: Disabled
Disabled.Description: Disabled compendiums will not show up for anyone (including GMs) in compendium browsers.

PF1.Help.Label: Help
PF1.Help.Desc: This is a reference sheet and information panel on various topics of the Pathfinder 1e system for Foundry Virtual Tabletop.
PF1.Help.Desc2: You can select topics on the left, whose contents will appear on the right. On the top of this window are navigational tools.

ITEM.TypeClass: Class, Racial HD, Mythic Path, etc.

SETTINGS.pf1CurWtL: 攜帶的貨幣會影響人物的負重。
SETTINGS.pf1NoExpL: 從人物卡中移除經驗條。
SETTINGS.pf1OpenXPDistributorL: 在戰斗結束時打開經驗分配器，在確認刪除戰斗時按住Shift可跳過
SETTINGS.pf1BackgroundSkillsH: 使用背景技能可選規則集
SETTINGS.pf1FractionalBaseBonusesH: 使用‘局部基礎加值‘可選規則
SETTINGS.pf1PCWoundsAndVigorH: 對PC適用'負傷與活力'可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1NPCWoundsAndVigorH: 對NPC適用'負傷與活力'可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1AutoCollapseCardL: 自動折疊聊天記錄中的物品卡描述
SETTINGS.pf1MeasureStyleL: 是否使用開拓者的測量樣式代替FVTT的默認樣式
SETTINGS.pf1LowLightVisionModeN: 昏暗視覺需要選擇指示物
SETTINGS.pf1LowLightVisionModeH: 勾選時，玩家若沒有點選指示物無法獲得任何指示物的昏暗視覺
SETTINGS.pf1CoinWeightH: 多少枚貨幣具有1磅重量
SETTINGS.pf1SharedVisionModeH: 如何處理玩家間的共享視野。
SETTINGS.pf1AllowScriptChangesH: 允許在世界中使用 "腳本"-類型的改變
SETTINGS.pf1AllowScriptChangesW:
該設定項會允許玩家們如GM般執行任意代碼。

你完全確定你想要啟用這個嗎？
SETTINGS.pf1AllowScriptChangesE: 該世界中已禁用腳本改變。
SETTINGS.pf1HideTokenConditionsH: 從token上隱藏增益和狀態圖標
SETTINGS.pf1obscureInlineRollsH: 將內聯投骰對擁有查看以下權限的玩家隱藏。
SETTINGS.pf1CoreEffectsH: 取消勾選便僅在token上顯示pf1狀態圖標，勾選則連核心圖標一并顯示
SETTINGS.pf1HideChatButtonsH: 是否隱藏聊天卡片上的按鈕，例如攻擊投骰上的應用傷害。
SETTINGS.pf1AttackChatCardTemplateH: 選擇攻擊投骰結果的樣式
SETTINGS.pf1UnchainedActionEconomyH: 是否使用Unchained動作系統可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1SkipActionDialogsH: 忽略行動提示框(例如攻擊/豁免時的提示框)除非你按住shift鍵點擊它
SETTINGS.placeMeasureTemplateOnQuickRoll: 快速投骰時放置測量蓋板
跳過行動提示框時放置測量蓋板.
SETTINGS.pf1InvertSectionFilterBehaviour: 反轉在物品欄中按住shift點擊物品篩選標簽的行為模式。
SETTINGS.pf1HideReachMeasurementsH: 不顯示觸及范圍，例如懸停在快捷操作上時。
SETTINGS.pf1DisplayIterativesH: 將BAB拆分成迭代顯示，而不是顯示總值
SETTINGS.pf1AlternativeReachCornerRuleH: 10尺觸及范圍不包括外圍角落
SETTINGS.pf1DisableAttackCardTargetsH: 禁用攻擊卡片上的目標角色顯示
SETTINGS.pf1ClearTargetsAfterAttackH: 是否在攻擊投骰之后取消所有目標。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigHint: 設置角色的生命值計算方式。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigInstructions: 為各種類型的角色設置計算參數。作為參考，PFS使用以下設置：自動計算，取期望值，其中一個HD取滿，向上取整，生命值浮動。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthRoundingHint: 生命值必須取整數。向上，接近，還是向下？
SETTINGS.pf1HealthContinuityHint: 生命值計算方式可以選擇連續或間隔。（固定）每HD取期望值，因此最終數值是平均的。（浮動）則按照[期望]-[取半]-[期望]的計算方式，因此最終數值是有一定的波動的。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigWoundsAndVigorPC: 對PC適用'負傷與活力'可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigWoundsAndVigorNP: 對NPC適用'負傷與活力'可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigWoundsThresholds: 為玩家啟用傷害臨界可選規則。
為非玩家角色啟用傷害臨界可選規則。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigWoundThresholdsP: 允許PC覆蓋傷害臨界設置
允許每個玩家角色單獨在人物卡設置頁面中覆蓋傷害臨界調整值的設置。
SETTINGS.pf1HealthConfigWoundThresholdsN: 允許NPC覆蓋傷害臨界設置
允許每個非玩家角色單獨在人物卡設置頁面中覆蓋傷害臨界調整值的設置。
SETTINGS.pf1DragRulerUseElevationName: 使用高度來決定移動類型
SETTINGS.pf1DragRulerUseElevationHint: 使用指示物的高度來決定其是正在飛行還是掘地

HideTokenTooltip.Name: 隱藏指示物提示
HideTokenTooltip.Hint: 按下此鍵時隱藏指示物提示

HideTokenTooltipGMInfo.Name: 顯示玩家視角的指示物提示

ForceShowItem.Name: 強制顯示物品
ForceShowItem.Hint: 是否在使用物品宏時在聊天中顯示該物品

SETTINGS.pf1UnitsL: 游戲世界中使用的單位制
SETTINGS.pf1DistanceUnitsL: 覆蓋所用的距離單位制。
SETTINGS.pf1WeightUnitsL: 覆蓋所用的重量單位制。
PF1.AccessibilityFontSizeHint: 改變游戲中某些特定位置的字體大小，例如攻擊投骰
PF1.TooltipWorldConfigHint: 改變世界中的提示設置
PF1.TooltipWorldConfigHideHeld_Hint: 對所有玩家隱藏所持物品

Extra.NewFeat: 你有一個新專長可選擇
Extra.NewAbilityScore: 你可以選擇一項屬性值+1

Alt.Desc: 你會獲得與種族和職業關聯的特殊能力作為該等級的天賦職業獎勵。

HP.Desc: 你會獲得一點生命值作為該等級的天賦職業獎勵。

Skill.Desc: 你會獲得一點自由使用的技能點作為該等級的天賦職業獎勵。

Roll.Desc: 你該等級的生命值將會基于你生命骰大小投骰決定。

Manual.Desc: 你會決定該等級自己獲得多少生命值。

Item.Name: 添加屬性值
Item.Desc: 該功能是用于追蹤你獲得生命骰時的屬性值變化的。

PF1.FlagsInstructions: 設置人物特質以符合PF1系統。
PF1.PointBuyCalculatorWarning: 購點計算器會覆蓋角色基礎屬性。
PF1.LinkHelpChildren: 關聯的附屬物品會隨其附屬對象(該物品)一起被刪除。
PF1.LinkHelpCharges: 關聯的物品從關聯對象(該物品)處繼承和共享充能。
PF1.LinkHelpClassAssociations: 職業關聯物品將在角色到達特定職業等級時自動添加。不像其他物品關聯，這些必須從合集包中關聯。
PF1.LinkHelpAmmunition: 關聯的物品將在使用關聯對象(該物品)每一次進行攻擊后自動減少數量(或充能)。
PF1.HelpSellMultiplier: 非交易品出售時的價格比率，默認為0.5。交易品總以原價出售.
PF1.HelpDomainSpell: 此法術在休息時不會消耗任何法術位來恢復。

PF1.AutoSpellClassLevelOffset.InfoBox: 如果你有可以替換你職業等級的進階職業，將其加在這里(例如 @classes.mysticTheurge.level)

PF1.SpellScoreTooLow: 你的屬性值不足以施放該環級的法術
PF1.ErrorGenericPermission: 你沒有權限進行任何動作
PF1.ErrorNoActorPermission: 你沒有控制該角色的權限
PF1.ErrorNoActorPermissionAlt: 你沒有控制角色'{0}'的權限
PF1.ErrorNoSpellsLeft: 你沒有剩余的該類型法術了
PF1.ErrorActorFormula: 角色{1}中發生{0}型公式錯誤
PF1.ErrorNoApplicableActorFoundForAction: 沒有適用的角色來執行'{0}'
PF1.WarningNoSizeDie: 無法確定適合 {0} 的骰子大小，默認投擲 {1}
PF1.WarningMissingAmmunition: 沒有與該攻擊關聯的彈藥。
PF1.WarningConditionalRoll: 投特定調整值{name}的{number}號公式時發生了錯誤
PF1.WarningCannotCreateChargeLink: 無法在{0}和{1}之間創建充能型關聯，因為{1}已經有自己的充能型關聯了
PF1.WarningCannotCreateChargeLink2: 無法在{0}和{1}之間創建充能型關聯，因為{1}已經關聯至{2}了
PF1.Info_FirstClass:
從{0}中拖出一個
或點擊上面的'+添加'按鈕。
PF1.Info_MissingClass: 你的人物缺少一個職業，查看人物卡概覽頁中的職業子標簽頁。

Use.Name: 使用
Use.Info: 當物品被使用時調用（攻擊，飲用藥水等）。有一個叫'attacks'的額外數組變量，內含了可能有的動作攻擊骰子結果。

Equip.Name: 裝備
Equip.Info: 當裝備/解除裝備物品時調用，有一個額外的變量'equipped'，值為'true'或'false'。

Toggle.Name: 開關
Toggle.Info: 當物品被啟用/禁用時調用。有一個額外的變量'state'，值為'true'或'false'。

ChangeQuantity.Name: 改變數量
ChangeQuantity.Info: 當物品的數量被改變時調用。有額外的變量'quantity.previous'和'quantity.new'，兩者均為數字。

ChangeLevel.Name: 改變等級
ChangeLevel.Info: 當物品的等級被改變時調用。有額外的變量'quantity.previous'和'quantity.new'，兩者均為數字。

PF1.FormulaAttackHint: 插入 {0} 以顯示迭代計數器。
PF1.DeleteItemConfirmation: 你確定要刪除該物品嗎？
PF1.UnsavedTinyMCE:
你有未保存的文本
你想要在關閉前保存嗎?
PF1.Name: 名字
PF1.ToggleSkillLock: 開關技能清單上幾乎不需要部分的編輯鎖。
PF1.SpellsTotalEachDay: 每日法術總量（不包括領域和學派法術）
PF1.OpenAssociatedCompendiumEntry: 打開已關聯的合集包項目
PF1.DomainSlotValueDesc: 領域/學派法術每環提供多少額外法術位?
PF1.CustomRollDesc: 該投骰使用的是非默認公式
PF1.Migration.Start: 為PF1系統版本：{version}執行遷移中。 請稍等。
PF1.Migration.Ongoing: 遷移進行中，請等待其完成。

PF1.Info.AddClassDialog: 你可以按住Shift來跳過該對話。
PF1.Info.AddClassDialog_Desc: 點擊“正常”會出現一個簡短的向導，點擊“原始”則會不作任何替換地添加一個職業。
PF1.Info.NotFunctioning: 系統(目前)不使用該特性

PF1.title: 開拓者 1
PF1.description: 一個全面的游戲系統，用于在FVTT環境中運行開拓者 1的游戲。
SETTINGS.pf1DiagL: 配置此系統中的游戲應使用哪個對角線移動規則。
SETTINGS.pf1InitTiebreakerH: 添加除以100的先攻總值以細分。
SETTINGS.pf1obscureSaveDCsH: 對玩家隱藏聊天卡片中的DC數值。
SETTINGS.pf1NPCProficienciesH: NPC角色也會使用擅長項。若禁用此項(默認)，他們會如規則文本中所述一般被認為擅長所有東西。
PF1.DeleteSkillConfirmation: 你確定要刪除這個技能嗎？

PF1.CustomVisionRules.Label: 自定義視野規則
PF1.CustomVisionRules.Description: 無視角色的感官，使自定義視野規則能正確應用。
